metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from site No.4 eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 31 May to 17 September, 2012. The site (100.35753° E, 38.87752° N) was located in a residential area in Yingke irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1561.87 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.2 m (6.2 m after 19 August); the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500A) was 0.17 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年5月31日至9月17日的通量观测矩阵中4号点的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市盈科灌区内，下垫面是村庄。观测点的经纬度是100.35753E, 38.87752N，海拔1561.87m。涡动相关仪架高4.2m（8月19日后涡动相关仪架高调整为6.2m），采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是17cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完整时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差，这一温差是主导因素。结果显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关法（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可以在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

The HiWATER experiment, on the other hand, is challenged by the poor availability of multiscale observations, necessitating a comprehensive observation system with multiple nested scales to capture eco-hydrological processes. Both endeavors highlight difficulties in accurate data acquisition and measurement under complex environmental conditions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: TSEB模型面临着有效分离土壤和冠层温度的挑战，以及在干旱地区处理环境中不确定性的困难。这些问题还受到图像分类和温度估计误差的影响。另一方面，HiWATER实验则面临多尺度观测的可用性差的问题，迫切需要一个综合观测系统，具备多个嵌套尺度，以捕捉生态水文过程。这两个项目都突显了在复杂环境条件下准确数据获取和测量的困难。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges in data quality control can be inferred from the need for extensive sensor calibration and the integration of diverse data sources in a multiscale observation system?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从多尺度观测系统中传感器需要广泛校准和整合多样化数据源中可以推断出哪些数据质量控制方面的挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of diverse data sources and the need for extensive sensor calibration suggest challenges in maintaining data consistency and accuracy across different scales and instruments. These challenges may include sensor drift, variations in sensor precision, and discrepancies in spatial and temporal resolution, which require rigorous quality control protocols throughout the data collection and processing phases to ensure reliable and interpretable datasets.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 不同数据源的整合以及对广泛传感器校准的需求表明，在不同尺度和仪器之间保持数据一致性和准确性面临挑战。这些挑战可能包括传感器漂移、传感器精度的变化，以及空间和时间分辨率的差异，这需要在数据收集和处理阶段实施严格的质量控制协议，以确保数据集的可靠性和可解释性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological considerations are necessary when using thermal infrared imaging to separate soil and canopy temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中使用热红外成像分离土壤和冠层温度以估算蒸散发时，需要考虑哪些方法论因素？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Methodological considerations include accurately classifying soil and canopy pixels using image classification techniques, correcting for atmospheric and surface radiation transmittance, and validating component temperatures with ground-based measurements. These steps are crucial to minimizing errors due to image classification inaccuracies and ensuring the reliability of evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous landscapes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 方法论考虑包括使用图像分类技术准确分类土壤和冠层像素，校正大气和地表辐射透射率，以及用地面测量验证组分温度。这些步骤对于最小化由于图像分类不准确而导致的误差以及确保在异质景观中蒸散发估算的可靠性至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy, uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences, and errors in determining component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures. Additionally, the strong advective environment further complicates the estimation process.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为可用能量与能量平衡的闭合不完全、表面与空气温度差的不确定性，以及从复合辐射温度中确定组分温度的误差。此外，强对流环境进一步复杂化了估计过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is multiscale observation considered a challenge in the field of eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测在异质表面的生态水文过程领域被认为是一个挑战，原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenge in multiscale observation for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces arises from the poor availability of multiscale data. This limitation hinders progress in understanding and modeling these processes accurately, necessitating experiments like HiWATER designed to capture data at multiple scales and across various disciplines.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上进行生态水文过程的多尺度观测面临的挑战在于多尺度数据的可用性较差。这一限制妨碍了对这些过程的准确理解和建模，因此需要像HiWATER这样的实验，旨在捕获多个尺度和不同学科的数据。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons for errors in the derived component temperatures when using image classification methods in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用图像分类方法时，推导的组件温度出现错误的原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in the derived component temperatures in arid regions are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. Misclassification of soil and vegetation pixels can lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, as well as errors in estimating incoming radiation transmittances, can introduce further uncertainties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 干旱地区衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。土壤和植被像素的错误分类可能导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率，以及在估计入射辐射透射率时的错误，可能会引入进一步的不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using a multiscale observation experiment for data collection in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在异质土地表面进行多尺度观测实验进行数据收集的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a multiscale observation experiment addresses the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, as it provides multiscale and multidisciplinary data through the use of a flux observation matrix, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用多尺度观测实验解决了在异质表面上进行生态水文过程上尺度化的挑战，因为它通过使用通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感提供了多尺度和多学科的数据。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the intent behind integrating multiple observation scales in the data collection method for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面上进行生态水文过程的数据收集方法中整合多个观察尺度的意图是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intent is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes by utilizing a hierarchically nested instrumentation setup that captures multiscale and multidisciplinary data, enhancing the understanding of these processes in complex environments.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 该意图是通过利用分层嵌套的仪器设置来应对生态水文过程的升级挑战，该设置能够捕获多尺度和多学科的数据，从而增强对复杂环境中这些过程的理解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in processing eddy covariance data for quality control and ensuring accurate flux measurements?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 处理涡度协方差数据以进行质量控制和确保准确的通量测量涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance data is processed using Edire software, which includes steps like outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density correction (WPL). Quality evaluation is performed on flux values, checking for atmospheric stability and turbulence characteristics. Data is filtered for instrument errors, precipitation impact, and missing data thresholds to ensure accuracy.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差数据使用Edire软件进行处理，包括异常值去除、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、超声虚温校正和密度校正（WPL）。对通量值进行质量评估，检查大气稳定性和湍流特征。数据经过过滤，以排除仪器错误、降水影响和缺失数据阈值，以确保准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are employed to accurately separate soil and canopy component temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation in a strongly advective environment?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流环境中，准确分离土壤和冠层组分温度以估算蒸散发所采用的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil and canopy component temperatures are separated using high-resolution thermal cameras to capture thermal radiation. The visible and NIR images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method, and their brightness temperatures are extracted from thermal images. These temperatures are converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation data and emissivities, allowing for accurate estimation of component temperatures.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件温度通过高分辨率热像仪捕获热辐射进行分离。可见光和近红外图像使用最大似然法进行分类，以区分土壤和冠层像素，并从热图像中提取其亮度温度。这些温度通过入射的长波辐射数据和发射率转换为辐射温度，从而实现对组件温度的准确估计。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the effective separation of soil and canopy component temperatures in strongly advective agricultural areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够有效分离强对流农业地区土壤和冠层成分的温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The separation of soil and canopy component temperatures can be effectively enabled by using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, high-resolution thermal cameras, and the series TSEB model, which leverages thermal images to accurately calculate component temperatures. This approach, validated against observed E/ET% and T/ET% using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, provides reliable estimates even under strongly advective conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度、高分辨率热像仪以及系列TSEB模型，可以有效地分离土壤和冠层组分温度。该模型利用热图像准确计算组分温度，并通过稳定氧和氢同位素验证了观察到的E/ET%和T/ET%的结果，即使在强烈的平流条件下也能提供可靠的估计。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the successful application of the TSEB model in estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些因素有助于TSEB模型在异质景观中成功估算蒸散发？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The successful application of the TSEB model in estimating evapotranspiration is contributed by factors such as accurate measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures using thermal cameras, reliable validation against EC system measurements, and the ability to separate latent fluxes of soil and vegetation components. The model's effectiveness is also enhanced by addressing uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences and providing separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% ratios.
Enablement.AnswerCn: TSEB模型在估算蒸散发方面的成功应用得益于多个因素，例如使用热成像相机准确测量土壤和冠层组件的温度、与EC系统测量的可靠验证，以及能够分离土壤和植被组件的潜在通量。该模型的有效性还通过解决地表与空气温度差异的不确定性以及提供E/ET%和T/ET%比率的单独验证得到了增强。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges could arise in estimating surface fluxes using the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model in strongly advective regions, and how can they be addressed?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强对流区域使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型估计表面通量时可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何解决这些问题？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in estimating surface fluxes using the TSEB model in strongly advective regions include the model's sensitivity to surface-air temperature differences and uncertainties caused by errors in determining component temperatures. Addressing these challenges involves using accurate ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures and validating model outputs with techniques like stable isotope analysis and eddy covariance measurements.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流区域，使用TSEB模型估计表面通量面临的挑战包括模型对表面与空气温度差的敏感性以及由于确定组分温度的误差而导致的不确定性。解决这些挑战的方法包括使用准确的地面测量土壤和冠层组分温度，并通过稳定同位素分析和涡度协方差测量等技术验证模型输出。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the primary challenges in using thermal infrared cameras for estimating soil and canopy component temperatures in agricultural regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在农业地区使用热红外相机估计土壤和冠层成分温度的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Using thermal infrared cameras to estimate soil and canopy temperatures poses challenges such as classification errors in image processing, which can lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures. Additionally, atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance errors can contribute to uncertainties in temperature estimation, especially in regions with varying vegetation abundance.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用热红外相机估计土壤和冠层温度面临挑战，例如图像处理中的分类错误，这可能导致冠层温度的高估。此外，大气向上辐射和透射误差也会导致温度估计的不确定性，特别是在植被丰度变化的地区。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data from multiple observation scales can be integrated effectively to study eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何有效地整合来自多个观察尺度的数据，以研究异质景观中的生态水文过程。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The integration of data from multiple observation scales was addressed through the HiWATER experiment, which was designed to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes using a hierarchically nested scale approach. This involved a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, along with hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验通过层次嵌套尺度的方法，解决了来自多个观测尺度的数据整合问题。该实验旨在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，涉及涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵，以及超高分辨率的航空遥感和同步的地面植被动态与光合作用过程测量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about how eddy covariance data can be accurately processed given the challenges of energy balance closure in strongly advective regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在强烈的平流区域中，如何准确处理涡度协方差数据感到不确定，因为能量平衡闭合存在挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Accurate processing of eddy covariance data, especially in strongly advective regions, involves addressing the energy balance closure issue by considering factors such as the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences. The TSEB model accounts for these uncertainties by using soil and canopy component temperatures, validated against observed data, to provide reliable estimates of energy fluxes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 准确处理涡度协方差数据，特别是在强烈的平流区域，涉及通过考虑表面与空气温度差异的不确定性来解决能量平衡闭合问题。TSEB模型通过使用土壤和冠层组分温度来考虑这些不确定性，并与观测数据进行验证，以提供可靠的能量通量估计。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe how the eddy covariance technique is utilized for data collection in heterogeneous landscape evapotranspiration studies.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差技术在异质景观蒸散发研究中的数据收集是如何利用的。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance technique is employed to measure turbulent fluxes, such as heat and moisture, in heterogeneous landscapes by using a setup involving an eddy covariance system. This system samples data at high frequencies (e.g., 10 Hz) to capture the rapid fluctuations in wind speed, temperature, and gas concentrations. This data is then processed to obtain 30-minute flux averages, after conducting corrections for coordinate rotation, frequency response, and density adjustments. Such a method is crucial for accurate evapotranspiration estimation over complex surfaces, as demonstrated in the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差技术用于测量异质景观中的湍流通量，如热量和水分。该技术采用涡度协方差系统进行设置，该系统以高频率（例如10 Hz）采样数据，以捕捉风速、温度和气体浓度的快速波动。然后对这些数据进行处理，以获得30分钟的通量平均值，并进行坐标旋转、频率响应和密度调整的修正。这种方法对于准确估算复杂表面的蒸散发至关重要，正如在黑河流域联合遥测实验研究中所示。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline how the HiWATER experiment addresses multi-scale observation challenges in eco-hydrological research.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: HiWATER实验如何应对生态水文研究中的多尺度观测挑战的概述。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment addresses multi-scale observation challenges by implementing a hierarchically nested observation system that includes flux observation matrices, eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. This setup is complemented by an eco-hydrological sensor network for soil moisture and leaf area index measurements. Additionally, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and microwave radiometers provides comprehensive data coverage. This approach facilitates the capture of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert regions, ensuring robust data collection across varied spatial and temporal scales.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验通过实施分层嵌套的观测系统来解决多尺度观测挑战，该系统包括通量观测矩阵、涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。这个设置还配备了生态水文传感器网络，用于土壤湿度和叶面积指数的测量。此外，使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和微波辐射计的超高分辨率空中遥感提供了全面的数据覆盖。这种方法促进了在绿洲-沙漠地区捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，确保在不同空间和时间尺度上进行稳健的数据收集。
